package.description: The Thread class provides a psuedo-thread implementation for Framework Objects. Each thread is sensitive to the object lifecycle, and can stop itself when the object is destroyed or when the framework is shutdown.

method.name: newInstance
method.description: Creates a new instance of a psuedo thread. The thread is bound to the object lifetime of the specified object, so that when the object is explicitly destroyed or removed from the ObjectRegistry, the thread will also terminate.

example.description: Demonstrate how to use the Thread component.
example.name: Example Thread #1
example.code: /* Prepare the MyThreadedObject for use with Engine */
/* Create a new thread for MyThreadedObject*/

class.name: ThreadInstance
class.description: A psuedo thread that is created by invoking the static thread class newInstance method.

method.name: handle_thread_start
method.param: An instance of a pseudo thread.
method.description: Invoked when the thread is starting.

method.name: handle_thread_stop
method.param: An instance of a pseudo thread.
method.description: Invoked when the thread is shutting down.

method.name: handle_thread_run
method.param: An instance of a pseudo thread.
method.description: Invoked when the thread is running an iteration.

property.name: ready_state
property.description: Object load and execution state. Follows: 0 unitialized, 1 through 3 variant, 4 ready, 5 destroyed.

property.name: object_config
property.description: Object API structure for storing sub structures: object_config.pointers and object_config.status.

method.name: getObjectId
method.description: Returns the unique id of the object.

method.name: getObjectType
method.return-value: The type of the object instance.
method.description: Returns the type of the object.

method.name: getObjectVersion
method.return-value: The version of the object instance.
method.description: Returns the version of the object.

method.name: getReadyState
method.description: Returns the state of the object.

method.name: restart
method.return-value: Bit indicating whether the thread was restarted.

method.name: getLastInterval
method.description: Returns the delay interval used to start the thread.
method.return-value: The interval in milliseconds used to start the thread.

method.name: run
method.param: Delay in execution between thread iterations.
Bit indicating whether the virtual handle_thread_stop method should be suppressed.
method.description: Runs the thread with the specifed delay.
method.return-value: Bit indicating whether the thread started running.

method.name: allStop
method.description: Invokes the stop method and prevents the thread from further execution.

method.name: stop
method.param: Bit indicating whether the virtual handle_thread_stop method should be suppressed.
method.return-value: Bit indicating whether the thread was stopped.

method.name: getIsRunning
method.description: Returns true if the thread is running, false otherwise.
method.return-value: Bit indicating whether the thread is running.

method.name: getIsRunnable
method.description: Returns true if the thread can be run.
method.return-value: Bit indicating whether the thread can be run.
